page.title: 10THE GAMEKEEPER
page.content: {The Gamekeeper} Mr. Cobb is gamekeeper of 700 acres at Ashe Warren. His job is to rear and care for game such as pheasant, partridge and deer. His year begins in April when he collects the eggs to hatch them in an incubator. After hatching they stay in cages until they are six weeks old, after which they are allowed to go free. There are eight organised shoots a year between October and January. It costs a man approximately 1,000 pounds for a 'gun' i.e. the right to go shooting for one day. At the end of the day he will be entitled to a brace of pheasants. Surplus pheasants are sold to licensed butchers. The gamekeepper employs 17 'beaters' for each shoot and he has four retrieving dogs to pick up the birds.
